name: swbatch
label: SWbatch
shortDescription: SWbatch allows for the batch inversion of experimental surface-wave dispersion data.
longDescription: GeopsyInvert is an application to rapidly perform multiple global-search inversions of experimental dispersion data with measures of uncertainty using the neighborhood algorithm as implemented in the open-source software Geopsy (www.Geopsy.org). UTinvert allows the user to rapidly and conveniently consider multiple inversion parameterizations to address the problem’s non-uniqueness, multiple starting seed values to address the problem’s nonlinearity, and in the future (developments on-going) a method to address how to best propagate the experimental dispersion data’s uncertainty into the resulting shear wave velocity profiles.

details.label: Working Directory
details.description: The directory containing the files that you want to work on. This directory and its files will be copied to where your Dispersion session runs. You can drag the link for the directory from the Data Browser on the left, or click the 'Select Input' button and then select the directory.

details.label: Analysis Name
details.description: Analysis name that is brief, memorable, and descriptive. Each output file will begin with this string of characters. No spaces or special characters are permitted.

details.label: Number of inversion trials
details.description: Number (positive integer) of inversion trials to perform per parameterization (3 is recommended).

details.label: Number of iterations
details.description: Number (positive integer) of neighborhood-algorithm iterations to perform per inversion (250 is recommended).

details.label: Number of initial random samples
details.description: Number (positive integer) of randomly sampled profiles to attempt before the first neighborhood-algorithm iteration (10000 is recommended).

details.label: Number of profiles to consider when resampling
details.description: Number (positive integer) of best profiles to consider when resampling (100 is recommended).

details.label: Number of profiles per iteration
details.description: Number (positive integer) of new profiles to consider per neighborhood-algorithm iteration (200 is recommended).

details.label: Number of profiles/dispersion curves to export
details.description: Number (positive integer) of profiles/dispersion curves to export (100 is recommended).

details.label: Number of frequency points in exported dispersion curve(s).
details.description: Number (positive integer) of frequency points in the exported dispersion curve(s) (30 is recommended).

details.label: Minimum frequency of exported dispersion curve(s) in Hz
details.description: Number (positive float) for minimum frequency of exported dispersion curve(s) in Hz. Selecting a value slightly less than the minimum frequency of your experimental dispersion data is recommended.

details.label: Maximum frequency of exported dispersion curve(s) in Hz
details.description: Number (positive float) for maximum frequency of exported dispersion curve(s) in Hz. Selecting a value slightly larger than the maximum frequency of your experimental dispersion data is recommended.
